NEW YORK
WORLD’S FAIR 1940
251
CITY OF NEW YORK
MUNICIPAL BROADCASTING SYSTEM
MUNICIPAL BUILDING
WORTH 2-5600
June 19th, 1942.
Mr. Prank E. Schooley,
Executive Secretary,
Office of ITAEB Executive Secretary,
Urbana, Illinois.
Dear Prank:
I have your letter of May 25th, 1942, and
I have had my Engineering Department look into it. My
Engineers said no because of what seemed to them to be
a law prohibiting the City Station from selling any
equipment to anyone. The legal big-shots insist that
that is correct.
It seemdl swell to me, button*t count on
us ..for equipment. However, I am interested in any list
that is prepared of material for sale, because we can
always buy material.
Very truly yours.
Director.
msmcrd
"New York City's Own Station"—810 Kc.
